intro: Dendrochilum derekcabactulanii, commonly known as the Derek Cabactulan's orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure and vibrant coloration. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Its flowers are usually small to medium in size, with intricate patterns and a distinctive fragrance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
